name: Pearl of the Orient
description:
You are a member of the Philippine Agency for Supernatural Beings - PASB for short. Your job comprises of numerous things, from relocating supernatural beings, helping gods and deities find homes in cities, acting as a diplomat between the supernatural beings and humans, to hunting down rogue beings who pose a threat not only to other supernatural but also to mortals.  

All is well, you're doing great in your work, maybe even expecting a promotion soon, humans continue living their lives without knowledge of supernatural beings roaming the streets beside them, and you've just relocated a sweet manananggal to a quieter home where she could retire in peace.

Everything is going great.

Until it isn't.

When news of supernatural beings going missing reach your agency, you are sent to the southern region of the Philippines; Mindanao, in a city called Orient, which is mostly inhabited by supernatural beings as well as small groups of humans who are aware of the presence of supernatural beings.

What should be a quick trip turns into a nightmare when a body is found.

Pearl of the Orient is a work-in-progress interactive fiction currently in its early development stages. The story follows you, the reader; a government employee, as you navigate yourself through the supernatural world of the Philippines, set in the modern times, and try to solve the mystery of the missing supernatural.

basically a (heavily) romanticized version of philippine mythology.

trivia: pearl of the orient (seas) is actually a nickname or a sobriquet for the philippines.

genre: mystery, supernatural, romance, rated 17+ for swearing, light depictions of violence, mentions of alcohol and substance use.
